intro: Leonia surinamensis, commonly known as the Surinam leopard plant, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its striking, velvety leaves that resemble leopard spots. The plant produces small, clustered white flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its unique appearance, it is a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
